tasks.title: Integrate dynamic obstacle model for robot navigation
tasks.description: Raj needs to work on integrating a dynamic obstacle model or a more adaptive approach to improve robot navigation, specifically addressing struggles with dynamic obstacles in real-world environments.
tasks.evidence: Nina: Okay, sounds like a plan. Can you prioritize that for this sprint? Raj: Yeah, I can work on integrating that this week, although I’m a bit swamped with other tasks, but I’ll try to make it happen.

tasks.title: Collaborate on a better LIDAR filtering approach
tasks.description: Raj will collaborate with Maya to find a better filtering approach for the new LIDAR sensor, which is showing sporadic spikes and noise issues, to improve obstacle detection.
tasks.evidence: Nina: Raj, could you help Maya with that? Maybe collaborate on a better filtering approach? Raj: Yeah, that makes sense. I’ll set aside some time to look into it. Probably Thursday or Friday.

tasks.title: Prioritize testing and tuning drift correction algorithm
tasks.description: Liam needs to prioritize testing and tuning the new drift correction algorithm he is developing, aiming to have a prototype ready soon.
tasks.evidence: Nina: Okay, Liam, prioritize testing and tuning that. Can you have a prototype by next week? Liam: I’ll do my best.

tasks.title: Draft methodology and experiments sections for the paper
tasks.description: Raj and Maya will be responsible for drafting the methodology and experiments sections of the upcoming conference paper.
tasks.deadline: TBD (by November 20th implicitly for final draft)
tasks.evidence: Nina: Raj, you and Maya can draft methodology and experiments sections? Raj: Yeah, sounds good. Maya: Sure, happy to.

tasks.title: Draft results and discussion sections for the paper
tasks.description: Liam will be responsible for drafting the results and discussion sections of the upcoming conference paper.
tasks.deadline: TBD (by November 20th implicitly for final draft)
tasks.evidence: Nina: Liam, can you work on results and discussion? Liam: Will do.

tasks.title: Draft intro and abstract sections for the paper
tasks.description: Nina will be responsible for drafting the introduction and abstract sections of the upcoming conference paper.
tasks.deadline: TBD (by November 20th implicitly for final draft)
tasks.evidence: Nina: And I’ll handle intro and abstract.

tasks.title: Attend paper writing session
tasks.description: All participants are expected to attend a scheduled writing session to work on the conference paper.
tasks.evidence: Maya: Should we schedule a writing session next week? Nina: Good idea. How about Tuesday at 3 PM? Raj: Works for me. Liam: Same here. Maya: Okay, Tuesday it is.

tasks.title: Check with admin for new LIDAR sensor order
tasks.description: Nina will check with administration to fast-track an order for an additional LIDAR sensor due to current heavy use and repair needs.
tasks.evidence: Raj: We might need an extra LIDAR sensor. ... Nina: Let me check with admin. Hopefully, they can fast-track a new order.

tasks.title: Help test patches for simulation environment update
tasks.description: Liam will help test patches when they become available to fix bugs in the updated simulation environment, particularly issues with the physics engine not syncing correctly.
tasks.evidence: Maya: Also, the simulation environment crashed twice last week. We need to update it. Liam: I can help test patches when they come out. Nina: Thanks, Liam. That’ll be a big help.

tasks.title: Plan and conduct a power audit for the robot
tasks.description: The team needs to plan and conduct an audit of the robot's power consumption, as battery life is low and some modules draw more current than expected.
tasks.evidence: Raj: Also, the robot’s battery life is low. Should we look into replacements or optimize power consumption? Liam: Yeah, I think a power audit is due. Nina: Let’s plan for that next week.

tasks.title: Monitor risks related to project progress
tasks.description: Raj and Maya should continue to monitor the identified risks: underestimating time needed for dynamic obstacle integration (Raj) and potential delays in hardware delivery (Maya).
tasks.evidence: Raj: The main risk is underestimating the time needed for dynamic obstacle integration. Maya: Also, potential delays in hardware delivery could hold us back. Nina: Okay, keep monitoring those.

tasks.title: Audit the data logging system
tasks.description: Raj will conduct an audit of the data logging system to investigate inconsistencies and lost data packets during wireless transmission. Liam will assist with this audit.
tasks.evidence: Raj: One more thing — I noticed our data logging system is inconsistent. ... Nina: Let’s have an audit of the logging system by Friday. Raj: Will do. Nina: ...Liam to test drift correction and assist with logging audit...

tasks.title: Address LIDAR sensor noise issues
tasks.description: Maya needs to continue addressing the sporadic spikes and noise issues with the new LIDAR sensor, potentially exploring more advanced filtering algorithms. Raj will collaborate on this.
tasks.evidence: Maya: Oh, speaking of sensors, the new LIDAR we got last month? It’s showing some noise issues. ... Maya: Yeah, I started with a basic median filter, but it might need something more advanced... Nina: Raj, could you help Maya with that? ... Nina: Maya to handle sensor noise...

tasks.title: Conduct further experiments to improve robot success rate
tasks.description: Maya will continue running experiments in the cluttered environment scenario with the goal of increasing the robot's success rate to at least 80% to be competitive for the conference.
tasks.evidence: Maya: Speaking of experiments, I ran the latest robot in the cluttered environment scenario last week. The success rate was about 65%... Liam: But we still need to get to at least 80% to be competitive for the conference. Nina: Maya to... run experiments

analysis_results.meeting_summary: The team reviewed progress on robot navigation, sensor issues, and paper writing for an upcoming conference. Key decisions included prioritizing robot stability for a December demo, finalizing paper experiments by November 20th, and scheduling a collaborative writing session. Several tasks were assigned to address technical challenges, resource needs, and system audits.
decisions: Experiments and results for the conference paper need to be finalized by November 20th.
A paper writing session is scheduled for next Tuesday at 3 PM.
Demo stability for the robot is the top priority for development leading up to the December robotics conference.
A power audit for the robot will be planned for next week.
